title: The Flag
content: OK. I see the new feature ’My buddylist’; and I see the ’Flag’ — what’s the idea of that Flag?
author: david hamuel

comments.content: Hovering over the “Flag” link with your cursor says “Notify the administrators this posting is problematic,” so I think it’s a way of tattling on spammers and/or jerks.

_...spammers and/or jerks._

I’d suggest a spammer is a jerk, no _or_ about it.

So is it me that decides who my buddies are? Or them? I can’t see a ’refuse to be buddy’ button. Not that I’m antisocial...

When you hit ’Flag’ do you get a chance to explain why you think the post is ’problematic’? And if you get flagged, do you get a black mark, three strikes, that kind of thing?

Man, there’s even a flag at the bottom of each person’s account.

My New Year’s Resolution is _Not to flag in haste nor to be flagged_. (It’s the kind of thing St Francis of Assisi would have gone for if he’d been a typophile.)

<cite>When you hit ’Flag’ do you get a chance to explain why you think the post is ’problematic’?</cite>

Yes.

Except robots are never jerks.

hhp
It’s a Flagged World After All :)
